full_title: All My Life by Falling In Reverse & Jelly Roll
title: All My Life

description.plain:
The lyrics of “All My Life” revolve around themes of personal struggles, self-destructive tendencies, and the desire for redemption and change. It is a reflective piece that delves into the complexities of relationships, inner turmoil, and the constant battle against one’s own demons. The lyrics portray a journey of ups and downs, mistakes made, and the longing for a better life despite facing numerous challenges.

In the first verse, the narrator reflects on their experiences of being both at the top and at the bottom, sober and drugged, indicating a turbulent lifestyle. They admit to seeking love in the wrong places and acknowledge having a bad reputation. Despite spilling blood in past relationships, they believe it was for true love.

In the chorus, a life full of mistakes is reflected upon, and the struggle to overcome them is recognized. Despite efforts to change, the narrator feels trapped in a cycle of dysfunction and expresses the desire to break free from it.

In the second verse, another voice, presumably that of Jelly Roll, joins to share similar experiences of ups and downs, going through hardships, and facing personal demons. Despite the desire for understanding from others, there is a recognition of being one’s own worst enemy.

In summary, “All My Life” is an introspective song that addresses deep themes of personal struggle, regret, and the longing for a better future, through powerful lyrics and a collaboration between Falling In Reverse and Jelly Roll.

Every time I go right, everything goes wrong
And I self-destruct when I'm close to love
